sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RASTENBURG a town of Germany, in the province of East Prussia, lying in a flat sandy plain on the Guber, 64 m. S.E. of Königsberg by the railway to Prostken. Pop. (1905) 11,889. Its principal manufactures arc flour, sugar, oil, beer and machinery. In the vicinity is Karlshof, a celebrated establishment for the cure of epileptic diseases.
See Beckherrn, Mittheilungen aus Rastenburgs Vergangenheit (Rastenburg, 1891); and Schaffer, Chronik von Rastenburg (Rastenbürg, 1889).
